```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
period <- signif(runif(1, 1, 10), 3) # seconds
  
ans <- signif(1 / period, 3) # freq (Hz)

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, delta = ans/10, format = FALSE, digits = 6)
sc$questions <- sprintf("$%g \\,\\mathsf{Hz}$", signif(sc$questions, 3))
```
Question
========
A wave has a period of $`r period` \,\mathsf{seconds}$. What is its frequency?

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```

Solution
========
Frequency is the reciprocal of the period. Therefore,

$$ f = \frac{1}{T} = \frac{1}{`r period` \,\mathsf{s}} = `r ans` \,\mathsf{Hz} $$
